article_title: State struggles to determine how many Alaskans lack health care access
article_text: Streur is also going through lists of emergency room visits -- notorious for straining the health care system -- and talking with providers to find out who falls into the impoverished population and what services are available, or lacking, in various communities. One finding he noted is that non-tribal members living in the Bush have better access to specialty care than those living in urban communities. Tribal health clinics "tend to pick them up and treat them one way or another," he said.

article_metadata.description: A new analysis commissioned by Gov. Sean Parnell hopes to determine just how many poor Alaskans lack access to health care, but the numbers are proving difficult to come by, according to the Alaska Department of Health and Social Services.

og.description: A new analysis commissioned by Gov. Sean Parnell hopes to determine just how many poor Alaskans lack access to health care, but the numbers are proving difficult to come by, according to the Alaska Department of Health and Social Services.
og.title: State struggles to determine how many Alaskans lack health care access

article_summary:
One finding he noted is that non-tribal members living in the Bush have better access to specialty care than those living in urban communities.
Tribal health clinics "tend to pick them up and treat them one way or another," he said.
Streur is also going through lists of emergency room visits -- notorious for straining the health care system -- and talking with providers to find out who falls into the impoverished population and what services are available, or lacking, in various communities.
